name: biomni-predict-rna-secondary-structure
title: Biomni: Predict RNA Secondary Structure
description: Predict RNA secondary structure from sequence using thermodynamic models
content:
Overview

Predicts RNA secondary structure from nucleotide sequence using thermodynamic folding algorithms and minimum free energy calculations. This computational tool identifies stable base-pairing patterns, hairpin loops, internal loops, bulges, and multi-branch loops that form the functional architecture of RNA molecules. Essential for understanding RNA function in bacterial gene regulation, riboswitches, and non-coding RNA mechanisms.

Input Parameters

  • rna_sequence (required): RNA nucleotide sequence (A, U, G, C)
  • output_format (optional, default: 'dot_bracket'): Structure representation format - 'dot_bracket', 'ct' (connectivity table), or 'bpseq' (base pair sequence)
  • temperature (optional, default: 37.0): Temperature in Celsius for thermodynamic calculations

Biological Use Case

Essential for microbiology and molecular biology research involving:

  • Riboswitch identification and characterization in bacterial gene regulation
  • Small RNA (sRNA) structure prediction and target identification
  • Ribosomal RNA structure analysis for phylogenetic studies
  • Transfer RNA structure validation and modification site mapping
  • CRISPR RNA guide design and optimization
  • Antisense RNA and mRNA interaction prediction
  • RNA thermometer structure analysis in temperature-sensitive regulation

Output

Generates comprehensive structural predictions including:

  • Predicted secondary structure in specified format
  • Minimum free energy (MFE) value in kcal/mol
  • Base-pairing probabilities and alternative structures
  • Structural motifs identification (stems, loops, bulges)
  • Visualization-ready structure representation
  • Thermodynamic parameters and stability metrics
  • Detailed prediction report (rna_structure_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
